com.brightcove.player.network

Class DownloadManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brightcove.player.network.DownloadManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDownloadManager

    public class DownloadManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDownloadManager
    Provides an implementation of IDownloadManager that uses an application database to track the requests. The requests placed in the database will be placed in DownloadManager's queue by DownloadMonitorService. Any request sets that have been marked for deletion will be removed from the DownloadManager's queue by DownloadMonitorService

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DownloadManager.Request
      Provides mutable implementation of IRequest, which can be used to submit download requests to the IDownloadManager.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.brightcove.player.network.IDownloadManager

      • cancelRequests

        @NonNull
public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> cancelRequests(long... requestIds)
        Description copied from interface: IDownloadManager
        Cancels one or more download requests. Each download will be stopped if it was running. If there is a downloaded file, partial or complete, it will be deleted.
        Specified by:
        cancelRequests in interface IDownloadManager
        Parameters:
        requestIds - an array of unique download request identifiers to be cancelled.
        Returns:
        a list of identifiers to the cancelled requests.

      • cancelRequestSet

        @NonNull
public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> cancelRequestSet(@NonNull
                                                                com.brightcove.player.store.DownloadRequestSet requestSet)
        Description copied from interface: IDownloadManager
        Cancels all the download requests in the specified set. Please note that calling this method simply causes the request set to be marked for deletion. The actual cancellation process will be handled in the background by the DownloadMonitorService. The DownloadMonitorService will stop queuing any pending requests in the set and remove all request that have been queued already. Finally the request set itself will be removed from the store.
        Specified by:
        cancelRequestSet in interface IDownloadManager
        Returns:
